Fix FB-16879: FDB print # no longer works.  You're welcome Alex :-)

It's tricky to handle "print #1234" now, because we now use asc's parser to parse the expression ("#1234"), and that is not a legal ActionScript expression.  To hack around this, we now detect "#" followed by one or more digits, but only at the very beginning of the expression.  If we see that, we replace it with "$obj(1234)".  $obj() is a new pseudofunction handled by the FDB, which evaluates to the object with id 1234.
This means you can do any of these:
but you can't use the "#" syntax anywhere except at the very beginning of an expression -- this won't work:

Fix FB-19648: 'Terminate' action during debugging does not close the browser on Mac if path contains spaces
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Session.terminate() now always tries to terminate the debug target regardless
of whether the debug target was launched with SessionManager.launch() or
SessionManager.accept().  Until now, Session.terminate() only tried to terminate
the debug target if it was launched with SessionManager.launch().
If you want to disconnect a debugging session without making the Flash player
exit, you are supposed to just call Session.unbind().
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Fix FB-16260:  If Flex app is already being debugged and you try to debug a second time, second instance terminates immediately.  This was caused by the fact that the debugger creates a separate thread to close the browser window, and sometimes, the new browser window would of course be open before the thread got around to looking for windows to close.

The whole separate-thread thing had been added a few years ago to fix an issue that no longer exists due to changes in the Flash player, so the fix is to change the debugger so that it does the terminate on the main thread.
